articles.title: ATLAS - Unlocking Functional Diversity in Homegardens
articles.description: Unlocking the Functional Diversity of Homegardens through meta-analyses and systematic reviews.
articles.contents: ATLAS project aims to synthesize data on species functional diversity in tropical homegardens to support sustainable agroecosystems. We collect and harmonize metadata from field inventories across regions, enabling meta-analyses and systematic reviews.

articles.title: Project Overview
articles.contents: This page presents the general objectives, scope, and significance of the ATLAS project on functional diversity in homegardens.

articles.title: Project Protocol
articles.contents: The protocol page details the systematic review methodology, inclusion criteria, and data extraction protocols applied in the ATLAS project.

articles.title: ATLAS Database
articles.contents: Access and explore the aggregated homegarden species inventory database collected from multiple contributors worldwide.

articles.contents: A curated list of references, software tools, and guidelines for systematic reviews and meta-analyses relevant to agroecology and biodiversity.
